original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields open steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields were steady at open on Thursday, dealers said while the interbank guidance peg by the Central Bank appreciated.
A bond maturing on 01.02.2025 was quoted at 31.95/25 percent on Thursday, steady from 32.00/15 percent on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 29.20/50 percent, steady from yesterday’s close at 29.20/50 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 28.55/65, down from yesterday’s close at 28.80/90 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.01.2028 was quoted at 29.00/30, down from yesterday’s close at 27.00/30 percent.
The Central Bank’s guidance peg for interbank US dollar transactions appreciated by 4.81 rupees to 353.65 rupees from 358.46 against the US dollar. (Colombo/Mar 02/2023)
